level.heading: POSTING REQUIREMENTS AND PENALTIES (§ 7-3213) The employer shall post and maintain in a conspicuous place a notice, prescribednd provided by the Mayor, which sets forth excerpts and summaries of the Actnd contains information pertaining to the filing of complaints assertingiolations of the Act. The employer shall post the notice in English and in all languages spoken by itsligible employees with limited or no-English proficiency as defined in section(5) of the of the Language Access Act, effective June 19, 2004 (D.C. Law5-167; D.C. Official Code § 2-1931(5)). An employer who willfully fails to post a notice pursuant to this section shalle assessed a civil penalty of one hundred dollars ($100) per day for each dayhat the employer fails to post the notice; provided, that the total penaltyhall not exceed five hundred dollars ($500) per violation. An employer shall not be liable for failing to post a notice until thirty (30)ays after the Mayor provides the notice required by section 10 of the Act tohe employer.
